newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Drunk driver fines bring cash for Russian church.
newsitem.headline: Drunk driver fines bring cash for Russian church.

text.p: Police in southern Russia raised over two billion roubles ($350,000) to build a new church by giving drunk drivers a choice of paying up or losing their licences, Itar-Tass news agency said on Thursday.

Tass, quoting the regional prosecutor's office in the city of Volgograd, said city drivers who failed drunk driving tests were given the option of transferring one million roubles ($175) to the fund to build the church or losing their licence.
The fine was 600,000 roubles for drivers from the countryside.
The prosecutor's office said some of the money from the 3,500 drivers who chose to pay up went to the church fund or was used to repair existing church buildings. ($ = 5748 Russian Roubles)
